page.title: 13CHANGES SINCE W.W.2-CONT.
page.content: Mrs. Wheildon continues her recollections: "The Church has traditionally been the focus of rural life,but today things are changing.Church fetes,flower shows and harvest suppers are no longer the focal point of village social life.The church at Butlers Marston is in danger of being closed,due to lack of congregation and support.The Reverend Wyatt comes every third Sunday from Ettington and has three parishes to care for,a practice becoming increasingly common in rural parts.To see such a beautiful and ancient building,the most impressive in the village lying idol and slowly decaying would be a shame indeed.There are just a few stalwarts left to clip the churchyard and keep the church clean, but there is no choir and the bells are silent,perhaps for ever."
